html: .@RulesDemocrats is also taking on health disparities w/ an important hearing on #MedicareForAll today. Dems were elected to ensure healthcare is a right for all Americans. We'll fight to: Protect those w/ pre-existing conditions Lower insurance premiums Lower Rx drug costs
text:
.@RulesDemocrats is also taking on health disparities w/ an important hearing on #MedicareForAll today. Dems were elected to ensure healthcare is a right for all Americans. We'll fight to:
Protect those w/ pre-existing conditions
Lower insurance premiums
Lower Rx drug costs

html: Cancer, diabetes, & heart disease impact communities of color at a much higher rate. But we have the ability to address these #healthdisparities by increasing access to nutritious foods and medical care. By righting these systemic injustices, we make our communities healthier.
text: Cancer, diabetes, & heart disease impact communities of color at a much higher rate. But we have the ability to address these #healthdisparities by increasing access to nutritious foods and medical care. By righting these systemic injustices, we make our communities healthier.

html: Black Americans tend to live in areas with more pollution. But, no matter where they choose to live, Black people are still disproportionately vulnerable to inhale unhealthy air. Why? They're more likely to have preexisting conditions. #NMHM19https://www.theroot.com/a-gumbo-of-unhealthiness-a-new-report-reveals-how-air-1834267923 …

Black Americans tend to live in areas with more pollution.

html: Despite coordinated attempts by President Trump and AG Barr to bury the facts, Mueller’s investigation did not exonerate President Trump. In fact, Mueller could not confidently conclude no criminal conduct occurred.
text: Despite coordinated attempts by President Trump and AG Barr to bury the facts, Mueller’s investigation did not exonerate President Trump. In fact, Mueller could not confidently conclude no criminal conduct occurred.

html: My colleagues and I relaunched the Bipartisan Task Force for Combating Anti-Semitism to lead Congressional efforts to condemn & combat anti-Semitism in all its forms. As co-Chairs, we will work to ensure that fighting anti-Semitism remains a priority for Congress.pic.twitter.com/zwOQZklbRj
text:
My colleagues and I relaunched the Bipartisan Task Force for Combating Anti-Semitism to lead Congressional efforts to condemn & combat anti-Semitism in all its forms.

As co-Chairs, we will work to ensure that fighting anti-Semitism remains a priority for Congress.pic.twitter.com/zwOQZklbRj

html: How we fight for #BlackWomensEqualPay: -Pass the Paycheck Fairness Act -Empower & support women in the workplace -Strengthen workplace protections for workers -Expand opportunities for high paying jobs Together, we must ensure all Americans earn equal pay for equal work.
text:
How we fight for #BlackWomensEqualPay:

-Pass the Paycheck Fairness Act 
-Empower & support women in the workplace
-Strengthen workplace protections for workers
-Expand opportunities for high paying jobs

Together, we must ensure all Americans earn equal pay for equal work.

html: #BlackWomensEqualPayDay Facts: -Black women make 63¢ for every $1 a white, non-Hispanic man makes. -Black women must work 19 months to take home the same salary a white man made in 12 months. We know this isn't fair for working families. This is why we fight for #EqualPay.
text:
#BlackWomensEqualPayDay Facts:

-Black women make 63¢ for every $1 a white, non-Hispanic man makes.
-Black women must work 19 months to take home the same salary a white man made in 12 months. 

We know this isn't fair for working families. This is why we fight for #EqualPay.

text:

html: This November, we need show our power at the polls. We need to turn out in larger numbers than we ever have before, and elect representatives who will protect our sacred right to vote.

html: As a lead plaintiff in the Veasey v. Abbott voter ID case, and founder of the Voting Rights Caucus in Congress, I’ve personally seen the barriers too many Americans face when casting a ballot. The cycle can’t continue.
text: As a lead plaintiff in the Veasey v. Abbott voter ID case, and founder of the Voting Rights Caucus in Congress, I’ve personally seen the barriers too many Americans face when casting a ballot. The cycle can’t continue.

html: Upholding voter purging in Ohio greenlights other states to purge registered voters from their rolls as a way to suppress and undermine our basic right to vote.pic.twitter.com/7Xj9iFchSb

html: The Supreme Court’s ruling today is a chilling decision with serious repercussions for democracy in this country. The National Voter Registration Act is one of our country's central voting rights laws, but this decision has opened the door to weaken the protections it provides.
